description.narrative: Transparency International Cambodia (TIC) is a chapter of Transparency International which as established in 2010. Its mission is working to fight corruption, and promote integrity, transparency and accountability in Cambodia. Oxfam in Cambodia has beenin partnership with TIC in 2016 under Finance for Development project. The contribution of TIC in phase I was the national-wide survey on citizen#s perception on budget transparency and accountability in Cambodia and engagement initiatives in the participation from young people on fiscal issues. In phase II, TIC will contribute with respect to tax exemption. Tax issue has attracted a lot of media attentions in recent years. While the country has committed itself to becoming an upper middle income countryin 2030, diversifying tax base is key to achieve this aim. The government has taken various measures in strengthening revenue collection while there is steady reduction in ODA. The expansion of the revenue collection has also created demands from citizensand civil society for fiscal governance to be more open and transparent. People need to know how money is raised, who pays and who does not pay their fair share of tax and how tax money is invested. It is important that everyone plays by the rules. Whilethe public is pressured for tax compliance, especially through tax on incomes, they are also skeptical about tax fairness. They also want to know if big companies or corporations have paid a fair share of tax. They are questioning if these large entitiesare complying with tax laws, or if tax incentives or exemptions are provided in a transparent manner. The public really wants to know if the government is acting in a fair and honest way. The government normally states that tax exemption is provided toattract investments to the country which in return generates jobs for people. In long-term, it is expected to receive more revenues from these entities through tax payments after the end of these exemptions or holidays. However, it is also argued that current tax exemption is not the most important factor for investment decision. Therefore, it should be more tailored rather than giving blanket offers as it reduces revenues for the country. It is also argued thattax exemption may also lead to tax avoidanceassome big countries are able to play with incentive/exemption rules which result in loss of state revenues. The issue can be raised at different platforms. It can be brought into agenda at the public-private public forum. It can also be raised at other key popular moments that may arise in the future. The issue can also be brought into social media. Public usage of social media as a medium of getting information is more extensive. It has become an important platform to bring messages directly to thepoliticians. Working with key development partners including the World Bank, the ADB, the SIDA and other partners is key for lobbying efforts. Through the collective voice, we may be able to have spare to work with key government institutionson realizing policy recommendations.

participating-org.narrative: Transparency International Cambodia (TI Cambodia) is a fully-accredited National Chapter of Transparency International. Our missionis to work together with individuals and institutions at all levels to promote integrity and reduce corruption in Cambodia. Transparency International Cambodia (TIC) is a chapter of Transparency International which was established in 2010. Its mission is working to fight corruption, and promote integrity, transparency, and accountability in Cambodia. Oxfam in Cambodia has been in partnership with TIC in 2016 under Finance for Development project. The initiative named “Young Budget Trackers” is created to bring together young and potential youth to contribute to policy research and advocacy on open budget, taxation, and pro-poor and FAIR tax and trade policy to the Royal Government of Cambodia to promote fiscal accountability and transparency. The initiative is proposed in line with the current strategic plan of TI Cambodia to engage and empower citizen and youth. It reflects TI Cambodia’s goal to strengthen the capacity of citizens and especially youth that serve to bring their interest around a common cause that matters to them such as fiscal accountability and transparency. Overall Objective: More open space for citizen and youth to actively engage in fiscal accountability through evident based advocacy on open budget, taxation, pro-poor and FAIR tax and trade policy at national and sub-national levels.
